solution_line_template: It costs {ferris_rides} rides x {ferris_cost} tickets/ride = <<{ferris_rides}*{ferris_cost}={ferris_total}>>{ferris_total} tickets to ride the Ferris wheel twice.
It costs {coaster_rides} rides x {coaster_cost} tickets/ride = <<{coaster_rides}*{coaster_cost}={coaster_total}>>{coaster_total} tickets to ride the roller coaster three times.
It costs {log_rides} rides x {log_cost} ticket/ride = <<{log_rides}*{log_cost}={log_total}>>{log_total} tickets to ride the roller coaster seven times.
In total Dolly needs {ferris_total} tickets + {coaster_total} tickets + {log_total} tickets = <<{ferris_total}+{coaster_total}+{log_total}={total_needed}>>{total_needed} tickets.
Dolly needs to buy {total_needed} tickets - {dolly_tickets} tickets = <<{total_needed}-{dolly_tickets}={tickets_to_buy}>>{tickets_to_buy} more tickets.
